article.description:
Troy Bell scored 28 points to lead
Boston College past Fairfield 90-78 on Tuesday in an NIT opening
round game.
article.headline: Bell scores 28 points to lead Eagles
article.linkText: Bell answers for Boston College against Fairfield
article.story:
BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Troy Bell scored 28 points to lead
Boston College past Fairfield 90-78 on Tuesday in an Owens Corning NIT opening
round game.

	   The Eagles (19-11), who advanced to play Temple, also got 19
points from Craig Smith and 18 points from Jermaine Watson.

	   Nick Delfico scored 14 points and Terrence Todd added 13 points
for Fairfield (19-12).

	   Fairfield trailed 67-64 with eight minutes remaining and had a
chance to tie, but Michael Bell's 3-pointer missed the mark with
the shot clock set to expire. The Stags never got closer than five
points the rest of the way.

	   Bell scored 10 points in less than four minutes in the second
half, including a 3-pointer with 4:11 remaining that ran the
Eagles' lead to 77-68.

	   Boston College, which led 46-38 at halftime, started slowly.

	   The Stags led 23-16 on Michael Bell's layup with 11:38 remaining
in the first half before the Eagles went on an 11-0 run.

	   Fairfield pulled as close as 51-49 on DeWitt Maxwell's two free
throws with 15:14 remaining in the second half.

	   The Eagles shot 54 percent from the floor and outrebounded the
Stags 39-32.

	   Fairfield was attempting to end a 30-year victory drought in the
postseason. The Stags last win came in the 1973 NIT, when they
defeated Marshall.

	   Boston College improved to 16-10 in the NIT, including 9-1 in
first-round games.
